text:
Hi Jamie

Apologies again for my slow reply, I have been in full interview mode it seems.

Thank you for the showreel tips – in the end, at the interview they watched a clip from one of my films instead. I think my next focus, while I am waiting for the outcome of this interview, will be putting together a showreel for a specific studio. I think just trying to do a general showreel first is quite hard. So, if I can focus it for a certain place it might help decide what my best work is.

The interview was really interesting, and I think I learnt quite a lot chatting with people in person about working in VFX. I think I should focus on a showreel, and maybe learning a broader range of programs – I was recommended to learn how to use Nuke.

It was discussed in the interview that a lot of studios don’t really have VFX runners now. Do you know what sort of roles are seen as entry level, if it is not being a VFX runner?

Additionally, I know it’s recommended on this scheme that you get work alongside the work you get on productions. You mentioned that you were on a similar version of the Trainee Finder scheme, and I was wondering if it was similar for you? – if so, what had you been doing?

By the way, the café tip you gave was very effective!
